member.name: T:Xenko.Audio.AudioEmitterSoundController
member.summary: This class is used to control a associated to a .

remarks.para: Instances of this class can not be directly created by the user, but need to queried from an instance using the readonly indexer.

An instance is not valid anymore if any of those situations arrives:
The underlying is disposed.
The is detached from its entity.
The entity to which it is attached is removed from the Entity System.

member.name: T:Xenko.Engine.AudioEmitterComponent
member.summary: Component representing an audio emitter.

remarks.para: Associate this component to an entity to simulate a 3D localized source of sound coming from the entity center.

Several sounds can be associated to a single AudioEmitterComponent. Use the dictionary to associate or dissociate a to the emitter component. Each SoundBase associated to the emitter component can be controlled (played, paused, stopped, ...) independently for the others. Once attached to the emitter component, a SoundBase is controlled using a . To get the AudioEmitterSoundController associated to a SoundBase use the readonly indexer.

member.name: T:Xenko.Engine.AudioListenerComponent
member.summary: Component representing an audio listener.

remarks.para: Associate this component to an to simulate a physical listener listening to the s of the scene, placed at the entity's center and oriented along the entity's Oz (forward) and Oy (up) vectors.
Use the AudioSytem's and functions to activate/deactivate the listeners that are actually listening at a given time.
The entity needs to be added to the Entity System so that the associated AudioListenerComponent can be processed.

member.name: P:Xenko.Engine.LightShaftComponent.SeparateBoundingVolumes
member.summary: If true, all bounding volumes will be drawn one by one.
member.remarks: If this is off, the light shafts might be lower in quality if the bounding volumes overlap (in the same pixel). If this is on, and the bounding volumes overlap (in space), the light shafts inside the overlapping area will become twice as bright.
member.userdoc: This preserves light shaft quality when seen through separate bounding boxes, but uses more GPU

member.name: T:Xenko.Rendering.Images.AmbientOcclusion
member.summary: Applies an ambient occlusion effect to a scene. Ambient occlusion is a technique which fakes occlusion for objects close to other opaque objects. It takes as input a color-buffer where the scene was rendered, with its associated depth-buffer. You also need to provide the camera configuration you used when rendering the scene.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.AmbientOcclusion.NumberOfSamples
member.userdoc: The number of pixels sampled to determine how occluded a point is. Higher values reduce noise, but affect performance. Use with "Blur count to find a balance between results and performance.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.AmbientOcclusion.ParamProjScale
member.userdoc: Scales the sample radius. In most cases, 1 (no scaling) produces the most accurate result.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.AmbientOcclusion.ParamIntensity
member.userdoc: The strength of the darkening effect in occluded areas

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.AmbientOcclusion.ParamBias
member.userdoc: The angle at which Xenko considers an area of geometry an occluder. At high values, only narrow joins and crevices are considered occluders.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.AmbientOcclusion.ParamRadius
member.userdoc: Use with "projection scale" to control the radius of the occlusion effect

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.AmbientOcclusion.NumberOfBounces
member.userdoc: The number of times the ambient occlusion image is blurred. Higher numbers reduce noise, but can produce artifacts.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.AmbientOcclusion.BlurScale
member.userdoc: The blur radius in pixels

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.AmbientOcclusion.EdgeSharpness
member.userdoc: How much the blur respects the depth differences of occluded areas. Lower numbers create more blur, but might blur unwanted areas (ie beyond occluded areas).

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.AmbientOcclusion.TempSize
member.userdoc: The resolution the ambient occlusion is calculated at. The result is upscaled to the game resolution. Larger sizes produce better results but use more memory and affect performance.

member.name: M:Xenko.Rendering.Images.AmbientOcclusion.SetColorDepthInput(Xenko.Graphics.Texture,Xenko.Graphics.Texture)
member.summary: Provides a color buffer and a depth buffer to apply the depth-of-field to.
member.param: The depth buffer corresponding to the color buffer provided.

member.summary: Keys used by and AmbientOcclusionBlurEffect xkfx

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.FXAAEffect.Quality
member.summary: The quality of the FXAA (directly related to performance). From 0 to 5 with , from 0 to 9 with and unavailable (should be 9) with .
member.userdoc: The quality of the FXAA (directly related to performance). From 0 to 5 with Medium dither, from 0 to 9 with Low dither and unavailable (should be 9) with no dither.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.FXAAEffect.InputLuminanceInAlpha
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the luminance will be retrieved from the alpha channel of the input color. Otherwise, the green component of the input color is used as a luminance.
member.value: true the luminance will be retrieved from the alpha channel of the input color. Otherwise, the green component of the input color is used as a luminance.
member.userdoc: Retrieve the luminance from the alpha channel of the input color. Otherwise, use the green component of the input color as an approximation of the luminance.

member.summary: Use the "stable bloom" rendering path.

member.name: T:Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehBlur
member.summary: This class represents a blur to apply to a texture to create a bokeh effect. It's not supposed to be used as-is, rather you should use subclasses like , or ... which do actually implement a blur technique leading to a particular bokeh shape (circular, hexagonal).

member.name: M:Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehBlur.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.param: The depth buffer corresponding to the color buffer provided.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehBlur.Radius
member.summary: Sets the radius of the blur. A child class can override it to do special processing when a new value is provided.
member.param: The new value of the blur.

member.name: T:Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehTechnique
member.summary: Techniques available to perform a DoF effect on a level. The technique directly affects the visual result (bokeh shape) as well as the performance.

member.name: F:Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehTechnique.CircularGaussian
member.summary: Circular blur using a Gaussian.
member.remarks: Fast and cheap technique but the final bokeh shapes are not very realistic.
member.userdoc: Use circular Gaussian blur to render the bokehs. This technique produce circular bokehs. It is fast and cheap technique but not very realistic.

member.name: F:Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehTechnique.HexagonalMcIntosh
member.summary: Hexagonal blur using the McIntosh technique.
member.userdoc: Use the McIntosh hexagonal blur to render the bokehs. This technique produce hexagonal bokehs

member.name: F:Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehTechnique.HexagonalTripleRhombi
member.summary: Hexagonal blur using a combination of 3 rhombi blurs.
member.userdoc: Use a combination of 3 rhombi blurs to render the bokehs. This technique produce hexagonal bokehs

member.name: M:Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehTechniqueExtensions.ToBlurInstance(Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehTechnique)
member.summary: Instantiates a new from a technique name.
member.returns: A Bokeh blur corresponding to the tehcnique specified.

member.name: T:Xenko.Rendering.Images.GaussianBokeh
member.summary: Applies a depth-aware gaussian blur to a texture.
member.remarks: This does not produce beautiful bokeh shapes, but it is quite light-weight and performance-friendly.

member.name: M:Xenko.Rendering.Images.GaussianBokeh.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Xenko.Rendering.Images.McIntoshBokeh
member.summary: Applies a McIntosh blur to a texture. (Hexagonal bokeh)
member.remarks: This is a 3-pass (+1 final gathering) technique based on the paper of McIntosh from the Simon Fraser University. (2012) http://ivizlab.sfu.ca/papers/cgf2012.pdf

member.name: T:Xenko.Rendering.Images.DepthOfField
member.summary: Applies a depth-of-field effect to a scene. It takes as input a color-buffer where the scene was rendered, with its associated depth-buffer. You also need to provide the camera configuration you used when rendering the scene. You can optionally specify which bokeh technique should be used, the number of LOD levels with their Circle-of-Confusion strengths and their resolution.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.DepthOfField.MaxBokehSize
member.summary: Maximum size of the bokeh (ie. when the circle of confusion is 1.0). This is resolution-independent, it is a ratio proportional to the screen width in percentage.
member.remarks: This property is not supposed to be modified at each frame since it generates garbage. Instead you should set it once for your scene and play with the DOF areas / lens parameters to make out-of-focus objects create bigger bokeh shapes.
member.userdoc: Specify the maximum size of the bokehs. This value is resolution-independent (proportional to the screen width in percentage).

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.DepthOfField.DOFAreas
member.summary: Areas of the depth of field: [nearStart, nearEnd, farStart, farEnd] expressed as a distance from the camera.
member.userdoc: Specify the area focused by the depth of field (eg. the not blurred area). It is expressed as distances from the camera: [nearStart, nearEnd, farStart, farEnd].

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.DepthOfField.QualityPreset
member.summary: Affects a preset quality setting, between 0 (lowest quality) and 1 (highest quality). This auto-configures and .
member.userdoc: The quality of the effect where 0 represents the worst quality and 1 the best one. Note that increase the quality of the effect significantly increase the rendering time.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.DepthOfField.Technique
member.summary: Bokeh technique used to blur each level.
member.remarks: This influences the bokeh shape (circular, hexagonal...) as well as the performance.
member.userdoc: Specify the technique used to calculate the bokehs. This influences both the shape of the bokehs and the performances of the effect.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.DepthOfField.AutoFocus
member.summary: Auto-focus on the pixel at the center of the screen.
member.userdoc: If checked, the depth of field area is automatically adjusted to the pixel at the center of the screen.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.DepthOfField.LevelCoCValues
member.summary: The number of layers with their own CoC strength. Note that you need to define at least 1 level of blur, each level of blur should have a CoC stronger than its predecessor and the last level should always have a CoC of 1.0. Example: { 0.25f, 0.5f, 1.0f } The higher the number of levels is, the smoother the transition between 2 levels is, but at a performance cost.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.DepthOfField.LevelDownscaleFactors
member.summary: For each level defined in you can define a downscale factor (a power of 2) at which to operate. When not specified, the levels are treated by default at half the resolution of the original image. Example: for { 1, 2 }, the first level will be processed at half the original resolution, and the second level at 1/4. The array provided must be of the same size as the array.

member.name: T:Xenko.Rendering.Images.ImageMultiScaler
member.summary: Allow to up-scale or down-scale a texture (input) multiple times while capturing intermediate mipmap results (outputs).
member.remarks:
Based on the input texture and output texture, this class automatically downscale or upscale the input texture to the different output textures. The requirement for the output textures are:
They must have a mipsize compatible with input texture (multiple of 2).
They must share the same pixel format.
They must be a different size from input texture.
They must scale to a single direction (either down or up scale, but not both).

member.summary: Use half resolution.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.LocalReflections.DepthResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the input depth resolution mode.
member.userdoc: Downscale the depth buffer to optimize raycast performance. Full gives better quality, but half improves performance. The default value is half.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.LocalReflections.RayTracePassResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the ray trace pass resolution mode.
member.userdoc: The raycast resolution. Full gives better quality, but half improves performance. The default value is half.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.LocalReflections.MaxSteps
member.summary: Maximum allowed amount of dynamic iterations in the ray trace pass. Higher value provides better ray tracing quality but decreases the performance. Default value is 60.
member.userdoc: The maximum number of raycast steps allowed per pixel. Higher values produce better results, but worse performance. The default value is 60.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.LocalReflections.BRDFBias
member.summary: Gets or sets the BRDF bias. This value controlls source roughness effect on reflections blur. Smaller values produce wider reflections spread but also introduce more noise. Higher values provide more mirror-like reflections. Default value is 0.8.
member.userdoc: The reflection spread. Higher values provide finer, more mirror-like reflections. This setting has no effect on performance. The default value is 0.82.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.LocalReflections.GlossinessThreshold
member.summary: Minimum allowed surface glossiness value to use local reflections. Pixels with lower values won't be affected by the effect.
member.userdoc: The amount of gloss a material must have to reflect the scene. For example, if this value is set to 0.4, only materials with a gloss map value of 0.4 or above reflect the scene. The default value is 0.55.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.LocalReflections.WorldAntiSelfOcclusionBias
member.summary: Ray tracing starting position is offseted by a percent of the normal in world space to avoid self occlusions.
member.userdoc: The offset of the raycast origin. Lower values produce more correct reflection placement, but produce more artefacts. We recommend values of 0.03 or lower. The default value is 0.01.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.LocalReflections.ResolvePassResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolve pass resolution mode.
member.userdoc: The raycast resolution. Full gives better quality, but half improves performance. The default value is half.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.LocalReflections.ResolveSamples
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolve pass samples amount. Higher values provide better quality but reduce effect performance. Default value is 4. Use 1 for the highest speed.
member.userdoc: The number of rays used to resolve the reflection color. Higher values produce less noise, but worse performance. The default value is 4.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.LocalReflections.ReduceHighlights
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether reduce reflection highlights during resolve pass. Performs filtering on sampled pixels to smooth luminance bursts. It helps to provide softer image with reduced amount of highlights.
member.value: true if reduce fireflies; otherwise, false.
member.userdoc: Reduces the brightness of particularly bright areas of reflections. Has no effect on performance.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.LocalReflections.EdgeFadeFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the edge fade factor. It's used to fade off effect on screen edges to provide smoother image.
member.userdoc: The point at which the far edges of the reflection begin to fade. Has no effect on performance. The default value is 0.1.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.LocalReflections.UseColorBufferMips
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether use color buffer mipsmaps chain; otherwise will use raw input color buffer to sample reflections color. Using mipmaps improves resolve pass performance and reduces GPU cache misses.
member.value: true if use color buffer mips; otherwise, false.
member.userdoc: Downscale the input color buffer and uses blurred mipmaps when resolving the reflection color. Produces more realistic results by blurring distant parts of reflections in rough (low-gloss) materials. It also improves performance on most platforms but uses more memory.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.LocalReflections.TemporalEffect
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether use temporal effect to smooth reflections.
member.value: true if use temporal effect to smooth reflections; otherwise, false.
member.userdoc: Enables the temporal pass. Reduces noise, but produces an animated "jittering" effect that's sometimes noticeable. If disabled, the properties below have no effect.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.LocalReflections.TemporalScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the temporal effect scale. Default is 2.
member.userdoc: The intensity of the temporal effect. Lower values produce reflections faster, but more noise. The default value is 4.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Images.LocalReflections.TemporalResponse
member.summary: Gets or sets the temporal response. Default is 0.9.

userdoc.userdoc: How quickly reflections blend between the reflection in the current frame and the history buffer. Lower values produce reflections faster, but with more jittering. If the camera in your game doesn't move much, we recommend values closer to 1. The default value is 0.9.

member.name: T:Xenko.Rendering.Images.LocalReflections.TemporalFrameCache
member.summary: Helper structure with data for temporal reprojection done per camera. Note: we may use the same camera for a few times per frame so every rendering pass should pick a proper data.

member.name: M:Xenko.Rendering.Images.LocalReflections.SetInputSurfaces(Xenko.Graphics.Texture,Xenko.Graphics.Texture,Xenko.Graphics.Texture,Xenko.Graphics.Texture)
member.summary: Provides a color buffer and a depth buffer to apply the depth-of-field to.
member.param: The depth buffer corresponding to the color buffer provided.
The buffer which contains surface packed world space normal vectors.
The buffer which contains surface specular color and roughness.

members.member:
Defines an effect permutation slot for a .
Each time an object is added to the render system, multiple effect instantiations might live concurrently. This define one such instantiation. To give a concrete example, a typical might define a slot for main effect, one for gbuffer effect and one for shadow mapping effect.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.SubsurfaceScatteringRenderFeature.DeduplicateMaterialParameters
member.summary: Turns material parameter deduplication on or off.
member.userdoc: When enabled, SSS material parameters are deduplicated every frame and therefore more unique materials can be rendered at once but it comes at a CPU performance hit. The maximum number of unique SSS materials that can be rendered per frame is defined in SubsurfaceScatteringBlur (because it depends on the bit depth of the material index framebuffer).

member.summary: Applies light attenuation with configurable hardness.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialHairLightAttenuationFunctionDirectional.Hardness
member.summary: Defines the exponent used in the shader.
member.userdoc: Defines the hardness of the transition from shadowed to unshadowed areas.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialHairLightAttenuationFunctionDirectional.BoundaryShift
member.summary: The interpolation factor used for shifting the boundary between lit and unlit areas.
member.userdoc: Use this parameter to shift the boundary between lit and unlit areas in order to mitigate shadow mapping artifacts.

member.name: T:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialHairLightAttenuationFunctionNone
member.summary: Applies no light attenuation.

member.name: T:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialDiffuseHairModelFeature
member.summary: The diffuse subsurface scattering for the diffuse material model attribute.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialDiffuseHairModelFeature.DebugRenderPasses
member.summary: Enables/disables color coding of each render pass.
member.userdoc: Enables/disables color coding of each render pass. The opaque pixels get colored in red. The transparent back-face pixels get colored in green. The transparent front-face pixels get colored in blue.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialDiffuseHairModelFeature.ShadingModel
member.summary: The shading model to use for the hair shading.
member.userdoc: The shading model to use for the hair shading. "Scheuermann approximation" offsers the best performance, but worst quality. "Scheuermann improved" offers better quality at slightly worse performance. "Kajiya-Kay shifted" offers the best quality at the lowest performance.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialDiffuseHairModelFeature.HairDirectionFunction
member.summary: Defines whether the tangent or bitangent vectors represent the hair strands direction.
member.userdoc: This option depends on how the 3D model was authored. If your 3D model's tangent vectors are aligned with the direction of hair flow, select "Tangent". If the binormal/bitangent vectors are aligned with the hair flow instead, select "Bitangent".

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialDiffuseHairModelFeature.HairShadowingFunction
member.summary: Defines whether to use traditional shadow mapping or subsurface scattering for shadowing the hair.
member.userdoc: Defines whether to use traditional shadow mapping or subsurface scattering for shadowing the hair. Subsurface scattering makes the hair partially translucent, allowing light to pass through the hair mesh.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialDiffuseHairModelFeature.LightAttenuationFunction
member.summary: Additional light attenuation.
member.userdoc: Additional light attenuation. Select "Directional" for attenuation based on the surface normals. Select "None" for no attenuation.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialDiffuseHairModelFeature.AlphaThreshold
member.summary: Defines the value used in the alpha test.
member.userdoc: Any alpha value above this value is considered opaque. ATTENTION: Make sure that the value defined in the specular hair shading model is the same as this one!

member.name: T:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularHairModelFeature
member.summary: The microfacet specular shading model.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularHairModelFeature.DebugRenderPasses
member.summary: Enables/disables color coding of each render pass.
member.userdoc: Enables/disables color coding of each render pass. The opaque pixels get colored in red. The transparent back-face pixels get colored in green. The transparent front-face pixels get colored in blue.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularHairModelFeature.ShadingModel
member.summary: The shading model to use for the hair shading.
member.userdoc: The shading model to use for the hair shading. "Scheuermann approximation" offsers the best performance, but worst quality. "Scheuermann improved" offers better quality at slightly worse performance. "Kajiya-Kay shifted" offers the best quality at the lowest performance.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularHairModelFeature.SpecularExponent1
member.summary: Exponent of the primary specular highlight.
member.userdoc: You can use this parameter to control the size and hardness of the primary specular highlight.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularHairModelFeature.SpecularColor1
member.summary: Color of the primary specular reflecton.
member.userdoc: Even though the primary specular highlight is theoretically white, you can modify its color for artistic purposes.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularHairModelFeature.SpecularScale1
member.summary: Strength of the primary specular reflection.
member.userdoc: You can use this parameter to control the strength of the primary specular highlight.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularHairModelFeature.SpecularExponent2
member.summary: Exponent of the secondary specular highlight.
member.userdoc: You can use this parameter to control the size and hardness of the secondary specular highlight.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularHairModelFeature.SpecularColor2
member.summary: Color of the secondary specular reflecton.
member.userdoc: The secondary specular highlight has a color that should depend on the hair color.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularHairModelFeature.SpecularScale2
member.summary: Strength of the secondary specular reflection.
member.userdoc: You can use this parameter to control the strength of the secondary specular highlight.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularHairModelFeature.ScalesAngle
member.summary: Controls the shift of the primary and secondary specular reflections.
member.userdoc: The highlights are shifted because of the angle of the hair scales. You can control this angle (real-life values are between 5~10 degrees) to vary the position of the highlights.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularHairModelFeature.ShiftNoiseScale
member.summary: Scale that gets multiplied with the noise value produced by HairSpecularHighlightsShiftNoise.
member.userdoc: Use this to control how much the specular shift texture should shift the specular reflections.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularHairModelFeature.AlphaThreshold
member.summary: Defines the value used in the alpha test.
member.userdoc: Any alpha value above this value is considered opaque. ATTENTION: Make sure that the value defined in the diffuse hair shading model is the same as this one!

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularHairModelFeature.HairSpecularHighlightsShiftNoise
member.summary: This texture is used to shift the two specular highlights to break the uniform look of the hair.
member.userdoc: This texture is used to shift the two specular highlights to break the uniform look of the hair.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularHairModelFeature.HairSecondarySpecularGlintsNoise
member.summary: The texure that is multiplied with the secondary specular reflections to give them a sparkling look.
member.userdoc: The texure that is multiplied with the secondary specular reflections to give them a sparkling look.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularHairModelFeature.HairDirectionFunction
member.summary: Defines whether the tangent or bitangent vectors represent the hair strands direction.
member.userdoc: This option depends on how the 3D model was authored. If your 3D model's tangent vectors are aligned with the direction of hair flow, select "Tangent". If the binormal/bitangent vectors are aligned with the hair flow instead, select "Bitangent".

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularHairModelFeature.HairShadowingFunction
member.summary: Defines whether to use traditional shadow mapping or subsurface scattering for shadowing the hair.
member.userdoc: Defines whether to use traditional shadow mapping or subsurface scattering for shadowing the hair. Subsurface scattering makes the hair partially translucent, allowing light to pass through the hair mesh.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularHairModelFeature.LightAttenuationFunction
member.summary: Additional light attenuation.
member.userdoc: Additional light attenuation. Select "Directional" for attenuation based on the surface normals. Select "None" for no attenuation.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularHairModelFeature.Environment
member.userdoc: Specifies the function to use to calculate the environment DFG term in the micro-facet lighting equation. This defines how the material reflects specular cubemaps.

member.name: T:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.IMaterialHairShadowingFunction
member.summary: Common interface for calculating the shadowing (light occlusion) for the hair shading model.

member.name: M:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.IMaterialHairShadowingFunction.Generate(Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialGeneratorContext)
member.summary: Generates the shader class source used for the shader composition.

member.name: T:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialHairShadowingFunctionScattering
member.summary: Trades traditional shadow mapping for thickness attenuated shadowing to fake scattering.
member.userdoc: Light will be scattered in the hair. You can control the scattering falloff with the "Extinction strength" parameter. Keep in mind that any shadow will create partial occlusion, even shadows cast from opaque objects onto the hair.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialHairShadowingFunctionScattering.ExtinctionStrength
member.summary: Controls how strong the scattering falloff is.
member.userdoc: Controls how strong the material absorbs the light. A higher value results in a "faster" falloff.

member.name: T:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialHairShadowingFunctionShadowing
member.summary: Shadows the hair using traditional shadow mapping. The hair will be treated as an opaque surface.
member.userdoc: Shadows the hair using traditional shadow mapping. The hair will be treated as an opaque surface.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialClearCoatFeature.LODDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance at which the base paint layer should transition to the metal flakes layer.
member.userdoc: The distance (in world units) at which the base paint layer transitions to the metal flake layer

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialClearCoatFeature.BasePaintDiffuseMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the base paint layer diffuse map.
member.userdoc: The diffuse map used by the base paint layer (the lowest layer). This determines the color of the layer.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialClearCoatFeature.BasePaintGlossinessMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the base paint smoothness map.
member.userdoc: The gloss map used by the base paint layer. For a coherent result, use the metal flake normal map as a mask.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialClearCoatFeature.BasePaintGlossinessInvert
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the is invert.
member.userdoc: Inverts the gloss value (eg a value of 1.0 produces zero gloss instead of maximum). This effectively turns the gloss attribute into a roughness attribute

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialClearCoatFeature.MetalFlakesDiffuseMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the metal flakes diffuse map.
member.userdoc: The diffuse map used by the metal flakes layer (the layer above the base paint). For a coherent result, use a value close to the base paint value.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialClearCoatFeature.MetalFlakesGlossinessMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the metal flakes smoothness map.
member.userdoc: The gloss map used by the metal flakes layer. For a coherent result, use the metal flakes normal map as a mask.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialClearCoatFeature.MetalFlakesGlossinessInvert
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is invert.
member.userdoc: Inverts the gloss value (eg a value of 1.0 produces zero gloss instead of maximum). This effectively turns the gloss attribute into a roughness attribute.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialClearCoatFeature.MetalFlakesMetalnessMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the metal flakes metalness map.
member.userdoc: The metalness map used by the metal flakes layer. For best results, use high values.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialClearCoatFeature.MetalFlakesNormalMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the normal map used for the metal flakes layer.
member.userdoc: The normal map used by the metal flakes layer. This shapes the flake geometry. If the texture has a high UV scale, enable "Use random texture coordinates" below to reduce tiling effects.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialClearCoatFeature.MetalFlakesScaleAndBias
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to scale by (2,2) and offset by (-1,-1) the normal map.
member.value: true if scale and offset this normal map; otherwise, false.
member.userdoc: Scale the XY by (2,2) and offset by (-1,-1). Required to unpack unsigned values of [0..1] to signed coordinates of [-1..+1].

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialClearCoatFeature.MetalFlakeslIsXYNormal
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the normal is only stored in XY components and Z is assumed to be sqrt(1 - x*x - y*y).
member.value: true if this instance is xy normal; otherwise, false.
member.userdoc: Calculate the Z component of the normal vector from X and Y, assuming Z = sqrt(1 - x*x - y*y).

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialClearCoatFeature.ClearCoatGlossinessMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the clear coat smoothness map.
member.userdoc: The gloss map used by the clear coat layer. Change this value to simulate different kinds of paint (eg matte).

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialClearCoatFeature.ClearCoatGlossinessInvert
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the is invert.
member.userdoc: Inverts the gloss value (eg a value of 1.0 produces zero gloss instead of maximum). This effectively turns the gloss attribute into a roughness attribute.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialClearCoatFeature.ClearCoatMetalnessMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the clear coat metalness map.
member.userdoc: The metalness map used by the clear coat layer

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialClearCoatFeature.OrangePeelNormalMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the normal map used for the clear coat layer.
member.userdoc: The normal map used by the clear coat layer to create an "orange peel" effect. This reflects light in different angles, simulating paint imperfections whereby the texture appears bumpy, like the skin of an orange.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialClearCoatFeature.OrangePeelScaleAndBias
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to scale by (2,2) and offset by (-1,-1) the normal map.
member.value: true if scale and offset this normal map; otherwise, false.
member.userdoc: Scale the XY by (2,2) and offset by (-1,-1). Required to unpack unsigned values of [0..1] to signed coordinates of [-1..+1].

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialClearCoatFeature.OrangePeelIsXYNormal
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the normal is only stored in XY components and Z is assumed to be sqrt(1 - x*x - y*y).
member.value: true if this instance is xy normal; otherwise, false.
member.userdoc: If there's no Z component in the texture, reconstruct it from the X and Y components. This assumes that Z = sqrt(1 - x*x - y*y) and that Z is always positive, so no normal vector can point to the back side of the surface. We recommend you enable this option, as Xenko might remove the Z component when you compress normal maps.

member.name: T:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialOcclusionMapFeature
member.summary: An occlusion map for the occlusion material feature.

member.name: M:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialOcclusionMapFeature.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialOcclusionMapFeature.AmbientOcclusionMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the occlusion map.
member.userdoc: The map specifying the ambient occlusion of the material. This modulates the amount of incoming ambient light to the material (0 => no ambient, 1 => full ambient). Ambient occlusions are generally used to produce coarse occlusions on the material (shadows, etc...). It is geometry related and thus ignores possible UV scale overrides.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialOcclusionMapFeature.DirectLightingFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets how much the occlusion map can influence direct lighting (default: 0).
member.userdoc: Specify how much the occlusion map should influence the direct lighting (non ambient lightings). Usually the occlusion maps are used only to affect ambient lighting, but using this parameter one can also have it partially affecting the direct lighting.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialOcclusionMapFeature.CavityMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the cavity map.
member.userdoc: The map specifying the cavity occlusions of the material. This modulates the amount of incoming direct (non-ambient) light to the material (0 => no light, 1 => full light). Cavity occlusions are generally used to produce fine grained artifacts on the material.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialOcclusionMapFeature.DiffuseCavity
member.summary: Gets or sets the diffuse cavity influence.
member.userdoc: Specify the influence of the cavity map on the diffuse lighting (0 => no influence, 1 => full influence).

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialOcclusionMapFeature.SpecularCavity
member.summary: Gets or sets the specular cavity.
member.userdoc: Specify the influence of the cavity map on the specular lighting (0 => no influence, 1 => full influence).

member.summary: Width of the scattering kernel in world space.
member.userdoc: This parameter controls how far the light should scatter (in meters).

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSubsurfaceScatteringFeature.Translucency
member.summary: Translucency of the material.
member.userdoc: This parameter controls how translucent the material is. "0.0" stands for no translucency and "1.0" stands for maximum translucency.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSubsurfaceScatteringFeature.TranslucencyMap
member.summary: Controls the thickness of the object. This value gets multiplied with the "Translucency" parameter.
member.userdoc: This grayscale map controls how translucent different regions of the model are. A brighter value results in more, and a darker one in less scattering. For example the ears of a person should scatter more than the top of the head, because they are thinner and therefore light passes through them more easily. This texture is multiplied with the "Translucency" parameter.

member.summary: The profile mixin to use for the scattering calculations.

member.summary: Common interface for calculating the scattering profile applied during the forward pass using the subsurface scattering shading model.

member.summary: Generates the scattering kernel that is fed into the SSS post-process.

member.name: T:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSubsurfaceScatteringScatteringKernelSkin
member.summary: Calculates the scattering profile for skin, which is applied during the forward pass using the subsurface scattering shading model. It also calculates a scattering kernel based on the "Falloff" and "Strength" parameters.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSubsurfaceScatteringScatteringKernelSkin.Falloff
member.summary: This parameter defines the per-channel falloff of the gradients produced by the subsurface scattering events. It can be used to fine tune the color of the gradients.
member.userdoc: Attention: This parameter only affects the SSS post-process. If you want to change the shading, use a different scattering profile. This parameter defines the per-channel falloff of the gradients produced by the subsurface scattering events. It can be used to fine tune the color of the gradients.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSubsurfaceScatteringScatteringKernelSkin.Strength
member.summary: This parameter specifies the how much of the diffuse light gets into the material, and thus gets modified by the SSS mechanism. It can be seen as a per-channel mix factor between the original image, and the SSS-filtered image.
member.userdoc: Attention: This parameter only affects the SSS post-process. If you want to change the shading, use a different scattering profile. This parameter specifies the how much of the diffuse light gets into the material, and thus gets modified by the SSS mechanism. It can be seen as a per-channel mix factor between the original image, and the SSS-filtered image.

member.summary: Common interface for calculating the scattering profile applied during the forward pass using the subsurface scattering shading model.

member.summary: Generates the shader class source used for the shader composition.

member.name: T:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSubsurfaceScatteringScatteringProfileCustom
member.summary:
Calculates a custom scattering profile, which is applied during the forward pass using the subsurface scattering shading model.
ATTENTION: This class is subject to change because it does not yet give you full control over generating scattering kernels and profiles.

member.name: P:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSubsurfaceScatteringScatteringProfileCustom.FalloffMap
member.summary: This parameter defines the per-channel falloff of the gradients produced by the subsurface scattering events. It can be used to fine tune the color of the gradients.
member.userdoc:
Attention: This parameter only affects the SSS post-process. If you want to change the shading, use a different scattering profile. This parameter defines the per-channel falloff of the gradients produced by the subsurface scattering events. It can be used to fine tune the color of the gradients.
Note: The alpha channel is ignored.

member.name: T:Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSubsurfaceScatteringScatteringProfileSkin

Locks the command list until is called on the returned value type.
This is necessary only during Collect(), Extract() and Prepare() phases, not during Draw(). Some graphics API might not require actual locking, in which case this object might do nothing.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether resource streaming should be disabled.

member.name: P:Xenko.Streaming.StreamingSettings.ManagerUpdatesInterval
member.userdoc: How frequently Xenko updates the streaming. Smaller intervals mean the streaming system reacts faster, but use more CPU and cause more memory fluctuations.

member.name: P:Xenko.Streaming.StreamingSettings.MaxResourcesPerUpdate
member.userdoc: The maximum number of textures loaded or unloaded per streaming update. Higher numbers reduce pop-in but might slow down the framerate.

member.name: P:Xenko.Streaming.StreamingSettings.ResourceLiveTimeout
member.userdoc: How long resources stay loaded after they're no longer used (when the memory budget is exceeded)

member.name: P:Xenko.Streaming.StreamingSettings.TargetedMemoryBudget
member.userdoc: When the memory used by streaming exceeds this budget, Xenko unloads unused textures. You can increase this to keep more textures loaded when you have memory to spare, and vice versa.

member.summary: Provides a summary of an available network interface on the device.

member.summary: The interface identifier provided by the underlying platform.

member.name: P:Sockets.Plugin.CommsInterface.Name
member.summary: The interface name, as provided by the underlying platform.

member.name: P:Sockets.Plugin.CommsInterface.IpAddress
member.summary: The IPv4 Address of the interface, if connected.

member.name: P:Sockets.Plugin.CommsInterface.GatewayAddress
member.summary: The IPv4 address of the gateway, if available.

member.name: P:Sockets.Plugin.CommsInterface.BroadcastAddress
member.summary: The IPv4 broadcast address for the interface, if available.

member.name: P:Sockets.Plugin.CommsInterface.ConnectionStatus
member.summary: The connection status of the interface, if available

member.name: P:Sockets.Plugin.CommsInterface.IsUsable
member.summary: Indicates whether the interface has a network address and can be used for sending/receiving data.

member.name: P:Sockets.Plugin.CommsInterface.IsLoopback
member.summary: Indicates whether the interface is the loopback interface

member.name: F:Sockets.Plugin.CommsInterface.NativeInterface
member.summary: The native NetworkInterface this CommsInterface represents.

member.name: F:Sockets.Plugin.CommsInterface.NativeIpAddress
member.summary: The Native IpAddress this CommsInterface represents.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.CommsInterface.EndPoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an IPEndpoint object that can be used to bind the network interface to specified port.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.CommsInterface.GetAllInterfacesAsync
member.summary: Retrieves information on the IPv4 network interfaces available.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.CommsInterface.GetSubnetMask(System.Net.NetworkInformation.UnicastIPAddressInformation)
member.summary: UnicastIPAddressInformation.IPv4Mask is not implemented in Xamarin. This method sits in a partial class definition on each native platform and retrieves the netmask in whatever way it can be done for each platform.

member.name: T:Sockets.Plugin.NetworkExtensions
member.summary: Helper methods required for the conversion of platform-specific network items to the abstracted versions.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.NetworkExtensions.ToCommsInterfaceSummary(System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterface)
member.summary: Returns a CommsInterface wrapper from a platform native NetworkInterface.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.NetworkExtensions.ToCommsInterfaceStatus(System.Net.NetworkInformation.OperationalStatus)
member.summary: Converts an OperationalStatus value to the abstracted CommsInterfaceStatus.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.NetworkExtensions.GetBroadcastAddress(System.Net.IPAddress,System.Net.IPAddress)
member.summary: Determines the broadcast address for a given IPAddress Adapted from http://blogs.msdn.com/b/knom/archive/2008/12/31/ip-address-calculations-with-c-subnetmasks-networks.aspx

member.name: T:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketClient
member.summary: Sends and receives data over a TCP socket. Establish a connection with a listening TCP socket using ConnectAsync. Use the WriteStream and ReadStream properties for sending and receiving data respectively.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketClient.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor for TcpSocketClient.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketClient.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Size of the buffer for the write stream.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketClient.ConnectAsync(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Establishes a TCP connection with the endpoint at the specified address/port pair.
member.param: The address of the endpoint to connect to.
The port of the endpoint to connect to.
True to enable TLS on the socket.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketClient.DisconnectAsync
member.summary: Disconnects from an endpoint previously connected to using ConnectAsync. Should not be called on a TcpSocketClient that is not already connected.

member.name: P:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketClient.ReadStream
member.summary: A stream that can be used for receiving data from the remote endpoint.

member.name: P:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketClient.WriteStream
member.summary: A stream that can be used for sending data to the remote endpoint.

member.name: P:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketClient.RemoteAddress
member.summary: The address of the remote endpoint to which the TcpSocketClient is currently connected.

member.name: P:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketClient.RemotePort
member.summary: The port of the remote endpoint to which the TcpSocketClient is currently connected.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketClient.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketClient.Finalize
member.summary: Allows an object to try to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before it is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: T:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketListener
member.summary: Binds to a port and listens for TCP connections. Use StartListeningAsync to bind to a local port, then handle ConnectionReceived events as clients connect.

member.name: P:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketListener.ConnectionReceived
member.summary: Fired when a new TCP connection has been received. Use the SocketClient property of the TcpSocketListenerConnectEventArgs to get a TcpSocketClient representing the connection for sending and receiving data.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketListener.StartListeningAsync(System.Int32,Sockets.Plugin.Abstractions.ICommsInterface,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Binds the TcpSocketListener to the specified port on all endpoints and listens for TCP connections.
member.param: The CommsInterface to listen on. If unspecified, all interfaces will be bound.
Allows handle inheritance. Might be ignored depending on platform.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketListener.StopListeningAsync
member.summary: Stops the TcpSocketListener from listening for new TCP connections. This does not disconnect existing connections.

member.name: P:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketListener.LocalPort
member.summary: The port to which the TcpSocketListener is currently bound

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketListener.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketListener.Finalize
member.summary: Allows an object to try to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before it is reclaimed by garbage collection.
